item.title: 台积电创始人称中美紧张局势将减缓全球芯片行业发展
item.description:
The founder of the world's biggest chipmaker, Morris Chang, said on Thursday that increasing tensions over technology between the United States and China will slow down the global chip industry.翻译:全球最大芯片制造商创始人张忠谋周四表示，美国和中国之间技术紧张局势的加剧将减缓全球芯片行业的发展。

Chang, who founded Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (2330.TW) in the late 1980s, made the remarks at an event hosted by the Asia Society in New York. The company has helped the democratically governed island of Taiwan become the world's leading producer of advanced chips.翻译:张于 1980 年代末创办台积电（2330.TW）的张是在纽约亚洲协会主办的一次活动上发表上述言论的。该公司帮助民主治理的台湾岛成为世界领先的先进芯片生产商。

U.S. officials earlier this month enacted another set of export restrictions that clamped down on what chips and chipmaking tools can be exported to China after Huawei Technologies (HWT.UL) last month showed off a phone with a new domestically manufactured chip.翻译:在华为技术公司（HWT.UL）上个月展示了一款采用新型国产芯片的手机后，美国官员本月早些时候颁布了另一套出口限制， 限制向中国出口芯片和芯片制造工具。

Chang, 92, said that cutting off China's chip industry from the rest of the world would affect other players beyond China.翻译:92岁的张表示，切断中国芯片行业与世界其他地区的联系将影响中国以外的其他参与者。

"I think that decoupling will ultimately slow down everybody. Of course, the immediate purpose is to slow China down, and I think it's doing that," Chang said.翻译:“我认为脱钩最终会减慢每个人的速度。当然，直接目的是减慢中国的速度，我认为它正在这样做，”张说。

Chang said that the effects of such decoupling were already becoming clear and that many previous economic conflicts between established and emerging powers had ended in wars.翻译:张说，这种脱钩的影响已经变得越来越明显，以前老牌强国和新兴大国之间的许多经济冲突都以战争结束。

"It looks like counties are mad at each other, that worries me," said Chang, who characterizes the geopolitical tension between the U.S. and China as an existing power confronting an emerging power.翻译:张说：“看起来各个国家都在互相生气，这让我担心。”他将美国和中国之间的地缘政治紧张局势描述为现有大国与新兴大国之间的对抗。

"Our only hope is it doesn't lead to anything even more serious," Chang said.翻译:“我们唯一的希望是这不会导致更严重的事情，”张说。

He also praised the higher education system in the U.S., adding his optimism about the country as TMSC invests to build chipmaking facilities in Arizona.翻译:他还赞扬了美国的高等教育体系，并对 TMSC 在亚利桑那州投资建设芯片制造设施表示乐观。

Born and raised in China, Chang built a career in the U.S., where he become a naturalized citizen in 1962, before being recruited to build the chip industry in Taiwan. He is now regarded as a legendary figure in the industry that's caught in the middle of the geopolitical tension.翻译:张在中国出生和长大，在美国开始了自己的职业生涯，并于 1962 年入籍美国，随后受聘在台湾建立芯片行业。他现在被视为陷入地缘政治紧张局势的行业传奇人物。

"I really think this country, which is my country, (the) United States, is still the hope of the world, that's in spite of all the problems we are having," said Chang.翻译:张说：“我真的认为这个国家，也就是我的国家，美国，仍然是世界的希望，尽管我们面临着所有问题。”

Reporting by Krystal Hu; Writing by Stephen Nellis in San Francisco; Editing by Sandra Maler翻译:胡晶晶报道；斯蒂芬·内利斯 (Stephen Nellis) 在旧金山撰写；桑德拉·马勒编辑

item.title: 美国议员质疑海军因官僚主义拖延台湾武器采购
item.description:
A U.S. congressional committee questioned the U.S. Navy on Thursday over what it called "alarming delays" in weapons deliveries to Taiwan, asking why production sometimes languished for months or years after purchasing deals were signed.翻译:美国国会一个委员会周四就向台湾交付武器的所谓“令人震惊的延误”向美国海军提出质询，询问为何在购买协议签署后，生产有时会停滞数月或数年。

Time was running out to deter military action by China toward democratic self-governing Taiwan, which Beijing claims as its own territory, Representative Mike Gallagher, chair of the House of Representatives' select committee on China, along with Representative Young Kim, said in the letter to Secretary of the Navy Carlos Del Toro.翻译:美国众议院中国问题特别委员会主席迈克·加拉格尔 (Mike Gallagher) 众议员和金英勇 (Young Kim) 议员在《华盛顿邮报》上表示，阻止中国对民主自治的台湾采取军事行动的时间已经不多了，北京声称台湾是自己的领土。致海军部长卡洛斯·德尔·托罗的信。

"Bureaucratic delays within the Navy are impeding the timely production and delivery of key weapons to Taiwan – including critical anti-ship missiles – and undermining efforts to prevent war," the lawmakers wrote.翻译:议员们写道：“海军内部的官僚主义拖延阻碍了关键武器的及时生产和交付给台湾，包括关键的反舰导弹，并破坏了防止战争的努力。”

They highlighted the need for anti-ship Harpoon and SLAM-ER missiles, both of which the U.S. has agreed years ago to sell to Taiwan.翻译:他们强调了对反舰鱼叉导弹和SLAM-ER导弹的需求，美国多年前已同意向台湾出售这两种导弹。

It took until April 2023 for the Navy to enter a contract for production of 400 ground-launched Harpoon missiles to Taiwan, the lawmakers wrote, noting that was 2-1/2 years after the Defense Department's October 2020 announcement of the sale to Taiwan of the weapons. That risked putting delivery beyond 2027, the year U.S. officials say is China's target date to be ready to conduct an invasion.翻译:议员们写道，海军直到 2023 年 4 月才签订了向台湾生产 400 枚陆基鱼叉导弹的合同，并指出，这是在国防部 2020 年 10 月宣布向台湾出售武器。这有可能导致交付时间推迟到 2027 年之后，美国官员表示，这一年是中国准备发动入侵的目标日期。

Gallagher and Kim said 10 months after Taiwan's December 2022 acceptance of deals to buy 60 air-launched Harpoons and 135 SLAM-ER missiles, the Navy still had not asked contractors to submit bids for production. Such lengthy timelines were not unique to those two systems, they added.翻译:加拉格尔和金表示，台湾于 2022 年 12 月接受购买 60 枚空射鱼叉导弹和 135 枚 SLAM-ER 导弹的交易 10 个月后，海军仍然没有要求承包商提交生产投标。他们补充说，如此漫长的时间表并不是这两个系统所独有的。

"The inability to supply key weapons at such a consequential moment in our efforts to prevent war is deeply troubling," they said, asking the Navy to clarify deadlines for Harpoon delivery and requests for bids for those missiles, and provide assessments for speeding up contracting and production.翻译:他们说：“在我们防止战争的努力中如此重要的时刻，无法供应关键武器令人深感不安。”他们要求海军澄清“鱼叉”导弹交付的最后期限和这些导弹的招标要求，并提供加快签约的评估和生产。

China has repeatedly demanded the U.S. end what Beijing sees as Washington's provocative support for the island's military.翻译:中国一再要求美国停止北京认为华盛顿对台湾军队的挑衅性支持。

The U.S., which like most countries has no formal relations with Taiwan, is the island's most important arms supplier, and top U.S. military leaders also have acknowledged the need to speed up delivery.翻译:与大多数国家一样，美国与台湾没有正式关系，但却是台湾最重要的武器供应国，美国军方高层领导人也承认有必要加快交付。

Taiwan has in recent years complained of delays to other U.S. weapon deliveries, such as Stinger anti-aircraft missiles. Taipei has asked the U.S. at times to turn to alternate suppliers or allies to help source equipment.翻译:近年来，台湾一直抱怨美国其他武器的交付出现延误，例如“毒刺”防空导弹。台北有时要求美国转向替代供应商或盟友来帮助采购设备。

Reporting by Michael Martina; Editing by David Gregorio翻译:迈克尔·玛蒂娜报道；编辑：大卫·格雷戈里奥

item.title: 随着美国的打压，中国急于用国内技术替代西方技术
item.description:
Summary:
  • Beijing has increased spending on domestic tech since late 2022翻译:自 2022 年底以来，北京增加了国内科技支出
  • Telecoms and banks likely next to be pushed to use more Chinese products翻译:接下来可能会推动电信和银行使用更多中国产品
  • Replacing Western tech due to geopolitics and cyberattack fears翻译:由于地缘政治和网络攻击的担忧而取代西方技术
  • Foreign firms still dominant in banking-related software翻译:外国公司在银行相关软件领域仍占主导地位

China has stepped up spending to replace Western-made technology with domestic alternatives as Washington tightens curbs on high-tech exports to its rival, according to government tenders, research documents and four people familiar with the matter.翻译:据政府招标、研究文件和四位知情人士透露，随着华盛顿收紧对其竞争对手高科技出口的限制，中国加大了支出，用国内替代品取代西方制造的技术。

Reuters is reporting for the first time details of tenders from the government, military and state-linked entities, which show an acceleration in domestic substitution since last year.翻译:路透社首次报道了来自政府、军方和国家相关实体的招标细节，这表明自去年以来国内替代正在加速。

China has spent heavily on replacing computer equipment, and the telecom and financial sectors are probably the next target, said two people familiar with the industries. State-backed researchers also identified digital payments as particularly vulnerable to possible Western hacking, according to a review of their work, making a push to indigenize such technology likely.翻译:两位熟悉该行业的人士表示，中国在更换计算机设备上投入了大量资金，电信和金融行业可能是下一个目标。根据对他们工作的审查，国家支持的研究人员还发现，数字支付特别容易受到西方黑客的攻击，因此有可能推动此类技术的本土化。

The number of tenders from state-owned enterprises (SOEs), government and military bodies to nationalize equipment doubled to 235 from 119 in the 12 months after September 2022, according to a finance ministry database seen by Reuters.翻译:路透社看到的财政部数据库显示，2022 年 9 月后的 12 个月内，国有企业、政府和军事机构的设备国有化招标数量从 119 起翻了一番，达到 235 起。

In the same period, the value of awarded projects listed on the database totaled 156.9 million yuan, or more than triple the previous year.翻译:同期，入库的获奖项目价值总计1.569亿元，是上年的三倍多。

While the database represents only a fraction of tender bids nationwide, it is the largest collection of state tenders publicly available and mirrors third-party data. China spent 1.4 trillion yuan ($191 billion) replacing foreign hardware and software in 2022, marking a year-on-year increase of 16.2%, according to IT research firm First New Voice.翻译:虽然该数据库仅代表全国招标的一小部分，但它是公开可用的最大的国家招标集合，并反映了第三方数据。 IT 研究公司 First New Voice 的数据显示，2022 年中国在更换外国硬件和软件方面的支出为 1.4 万亿元人民币（1910 亿美元），同比增长 16.2%。

But Beijing's lack of advanced chip-manufacturing capabilities prevents it from completely substituting products with alternatives that are entirely locally made, analysts say.翻译:但分析人士表示，北京缺乏先进的芯片制造能力，使其无法用完全本地制造的替代品完全替代产品。

Previous domestic substitution efforts stalled because China did not have the "technical chops to pull off localization until now, and to a certain extent they still kind of don't," said Kendra Schaefer, head of tech policy research at Beijing-based consultancy Trivium China.翻译:北京咨询公司 Trivium 技术政策研究主管肯德拉·谢弗 (Kendra Schaefer) 表示，之前的国内替代努力陷入停滞，因为中国“直到现在还不具备实现本地化的技术能力，而且在某种程度上仍然不具备”。中国。

FEAR OF DEPENDENCE

SOEs were instructed last year to replace office software systems with domestic products by 2027, the first time such specific deadlines were imposed, according to five brokerage firms that cited a September 2022 order from China's state asset regulator. Reuters could not independently verify the order.翻译:五家券商援引中国国有资产监管机构 2022 年 9 月的命令称，去年，国有企业被要求在 2027 年之前用国产产品更换办公软件系统，这是首次规定这样的具体期限。路透社无法独立核实该订单。

Domestic replacement projects this year have targeted markedly sensitive infrastructure, the tenders show.翻译:招标显示，今年的国内更换项目主要针对敏感的基础设施。

One partially redacted tender for a "certain government department in Gansu province" assigned 4.4 million yuan to replace an intelligence-gathering system's equipment, without providing specifics.翻译:一份经过部分修改的招标书为“甘肃省某政府部门”拨款 440 万元人民币，用于更换情报收集系统的设备，但没有提供具体细节。

People's Liberation Army units in the northeastern city of Harbin and Xiamen in the south last December meanwhile issued tenders to replace foreign-made computers.翻译:去年12月，位于东北城市哈尔滨和南部城市厦门的中国人民解放军部队同时发布了更换外国制造计算机的招标。

Tech researchers such as Mo Jianlei of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, the country's largest state-run research organization, said the Chinese government was increasingly concerned about Western equipment being hacked by foreign powers.翻译:中国最大的国有研究机构中国科学院的莫建雷等科技研究人员表示，中国政府越来越担心西方设备遭到外国势力的黑客攻击。

The state asset regulator did not return a request for comment.翻译:国有资产监管机构没有回复置评请求。

Over the past year, state-linked researchers also called on Beijing to strengthen anti-hacking defences in its financial infrastructure due to geopolitical concerns.翻译:过去一年，出于地缘政治担忧，与国家相关的研究人员还呼吁北京加强金融基础设施的反黑客防御。

One March research paper highlighted the dependence of China's UnionPay credit card system on U.S software firm BMC for settlements.翻译:3 月份的一篇研究论文强调了中国银联信用卡系统对美国软件公司 BMC 结算的依赖。

"Beware of security vulnerabilities in hardware and software set by the U.S. side ... build a financial security 'firewall'," the researchers wrote.翻译:研究人员写道：“谨防美方设置的硬件和软件安全漏洞……建立金融安全‘防火墙’。”

BMC declined to comment.翻译:BMC 拒绝置评。

An article published this year in the journal Cyberspace Security by researchers from the state-run China Telecommunications Corporation concluded the country was overdependent on chips made by U.S. giant Qualcomm (QCOM.O) for back-end management, as well as on the iOS and Android systems.翻译:国营中国电信集团公司的研究人员今年在《网络空间安全》杂志上发表的一篇文章得出的结论是，中国过度依赖美国巨头高通(QCOM.O)生产的后端管理芯片以及 iOS 和安卓系统。

"(They) are all firmly controlled by American companies," the researchers wrote.翻译:“（它们）都被美国公司牢牢控制，”研究人员写道。

As China has not signed World Trade Organization clauses governing public procurement, the substitution effort does not appear to violate international accords, according to the U.S. Treasury. The U.S. has implemented similar rules barring Chinese companies from public sector bids.翻译:美国财政部称，由于中国尚未签署世界贸易组织有关公共采购的条款，因此替代努力似乎并未违反国际协议。美国也实施了类似的规则，禁止中国公司参与公共部门投标。

Qualcomm, Google (GOOGL.O) and Apple (AAPL.O) did not immediately return requests for comment.翻译:高通、谷歌(GOOGL.O)和苹果(AAPL.O)没有立即回复置评请求。

WINNERS AND LOSERS

China's effort to build an independent computing system dates back to at least its 2006 five-year plan for science and technology development, which listed the semiconductor and software systems sectors as national priorities.翻译:中国建立独立计算系统的努力至少可以追溯到2006年的科技发展五年计划，该计划将半导体和软件系统行业列为国家优先发展领域。

This effort spawned state-owned companies that are increasingly winning major contracts. Two firms awarded the Harbin tenders were subsidiaries of China Electronics Corporation and China Electronics Technology Group Corporation - both heavily targeted by U.S. sanctions.翻译:这种努力催生了越来越多的国有企业赢得重大合同。哈尔滨招标的两家公司是中国电子信息产业集团公司和中国电子科技集团公司的子公司，这两家公司都是美国制裁的重点目标。

The state regulator's 2022 order pushed SOEs away from U.S. companies such as Microsoft (MSFT.O) and Adobe (ADBE.O), according to an employee of a Beijing-based firm that develops domestic office-processing software翻译:北京一家开发国内办公处理软件的公司的一名员工表示，国家监管机构的 2022 年命令迫使国有企业远离微软(MSFT.O)和 Adob​​e (ADBE.O)等美国公司

China Tobacco, for example, in July began switching some subsidiaries from Microsoft Windows to Huawei's EulerOS, according to an employee of a software vendor that services the state-owned manufacturer.翻译:例如，据为该国有制造商提供服务的软件供应商的一名员工透露，中国烟草于 7 月开始将部分子公司从微软 Windows 切换到华为的 EulerOS。

The people spoke on condition of anonymity because they were not authorized to discuss clients and competitors.翻译:这些人士要求匿名，因为他们无权讨论客户和竞争对手。

For years, Western tech companies have shared their source code and entered into partnerships with domestic firms to address Beijing's concerns, but prominent computer scientists such as Ni Guangnan of the Chinese Academy of Engineering have said such measures are not sufficient for China's security needs.翻译:多年来，西方科技公司一直共享源代码并与国内公司建立合作伙伴关系，以解决北京方面的担忧，但中国工程院院士倪光南等著名计算机科学家表示，此类措施不足以满足中国的安全需求。

China Tobacco, Microsoft and Adobe did not respond to requests for comment.翻译:中国烟草、微软和Adobe没有回应置评请求。

In September, Reuters and other outlets reported that some employees of central government agencies were banned from using iPhones at work.翻译:9 月，路透社和其他媒体报道称，中央政府机构的一些员工被禁止在工作中使用 iPhone。

"In certain sectors, customers ... are opting for domestic suppliers, with foreign suppliers frequently facing informal barriers," the European Union Chamber of Commerce in Beijing said in response to Reuters questions.翻译:“在某些领域，客户……正在选择国内供应商，而外国供应商经常面临非正式障碍，”北京欧盟商会在回答路透社的问题时表示。

In a 2023 American Chamber of Commerce (AmCham) in Shanghai report, 89% of the organization's tech business members named procurement practices favoring domestic competitors as a regulatory obstacle. It was the highest percentage of any sector.翻译:在上海美国商会 (AmCham) 2023 年的一份报告中，该组织 89% 的科技企业成员将有利于国内竞争对手的采购做法视为监管障碍。这是所有行业中比例最高的。

AmCham Shanghai President Eric Zheng acknowledged China's national security concerns but said he hoped "normal procurement procedures will not be politicized so that US companies can compete fairly and pursue commercial opportunities ... to benefit both countries."翻译:上海美国商会会长郑重承认中国的国家安全担忧，但表示希望“正常采购程序不会被政治化，以便美国公司能够公平竞争并寻求商业机会……让两国受益。”

The U.S. Department of Commerce, China Electronics Corporation and China Electronics Technology Group Corporation did not return requests for comment.翻译:美国商务部、中国电子信息产业集团公司和中国电子科技集团公司没有回复置评请求。

HUAWEI PRIZED

Chinese tech conglomerate Huawei has emerged as the leading firm in this replacement cycle, according to three people familiar with China's enterprise tech industry, who spoke on condition of anonymity given the sensitivity of the issue.翻译:据三位熟悉中国企业科技行业的人士透露，中国科技集团华为已成为这一更换周期中的领头羊。考虑到问题的敏感性，这些人士要求匿名。

In 2022, Huawei's enterprise business, which includes software and cloud computing operations, reported 133 billion yuan in sales, up 30% on the previous year.翻译:2022年，包括软件和云计算业务在内的华为企业业务销售额达1330亿元人民币，较上年增长30%。

One of the people said privately-held Huawei was seen as more nimble than state-owned groups in rolling out products and executing projects.翻译:其中一位人士表示，私营企业华为在推出产品和执行项目方面被认为比国有企业更加灵活。

The other two sources highlighted Huawei's broad product suite - spanning chips to software - as an advantage.翻译:另外两位消息人士强调了华为广泛的产品系列（从芯片到软件）的优势。

Clients also prize Huawei for its ability to process data on internal company servers and external cloud networks, as well as its wide offering of cybersecurity products, according to the employee of a China Tobacco tech supplier.翻译:据中烟一家技术供应商的员工称，客户还因其处理公司内部服务器和外部云网络数据的能力以及提供广泛的网络安全产品而对华为表示赞赏。

Huawei declined to comment.翻译:华为拒绝置评。

The replacement drive has re-drawn entire sub-sectors of the software industry. The combined China market share held by five major foreign makers of database management systems – the majority of which are American - dropped from 57.3% in 2018 to 27.3% by the end of 2022, according to industry group IDC.翻译:更换驱动器重新绘制了软件行业的整个子行业。根据行业组织 IDC 的数据，五家主要外国数据库管理系统制造商（其中大部分是美国制造商）在中国的市场份额合计从 2018 年的 57.3% 下降到 2022 年底的 27.3%。

Despite heavy spending on domestic substitution, however, foreign firms are still dominant suppliers for banking and telecoms database management. Non-Chinese companies held 90% of market share for banking database systems at the end of 2022, according to EqualOcean, a tech consultancy.翻译:然而，尽管在国内替代方面投入了大量资金，外国公司仍然是银行和电信数据库管理的主要供应商。根据科技咨询公司 EqualOcean 的数据，截至 2022 年底，非中国公司占据了银行数据库系统 90% 的市场份额。

Financial institutions are generally reluctant to switch database systems despite government pressure, said one of the industry sources, adding that they have higher stability requirements than many other sectors and local players cannot yet match their needs.翻译:一位业内人士表示，尽管有政府压力，金融机构普遍不愿更换数据库系统，并补充说，金融机构对稳定性的要求比许多其他行业更高，而本地企业还无法满足他们的需求。

Even for personal computers, banks that switch from an international brand to China's dominant supplier Lenovo (0992.HK) would still be reliant on critical chip components provided by Western firms, one of the industry sources said.翻译:一位业内消息人士称，即使在个人电脑方面，从国际品牌转向中国主要供应商联想（0992.HK）的银行仍将依赖西方公司提供的关键芯片组件。

($1 = 7.3165 Chinese yuan)翻译:（1 美元 = 7.3165 人民币）

Reporting by Beijing newsroom; Editing by Brenda Goh and Katerina Ang翻译:北京新闻编辑室报道；编辑：Brenda Goh 和 Katerina Ang

item.title: 苏纳克表示英国将建立世界上第一个人工智能安全研究所
item.description:
Britain will set up the world's first artificial intelligence (AI) safety institute, Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said on Thursday before he hosts a gathering next week of representatives of AI companies, political leaders and experts.翻译:英国首相里希·苏纳克 (Rishi Sunak) 周四表示，英国将建立世界上第一个人工智能 (AI) 安全研究所，然后下周将召开人工智能公司代表、政治领导人和专家的聚会。

The institute "will advance the world's knowledge of AI safety and it will carefully examine, evaluate and test new types of AI so that we understand what each new model is capable of, exploring all the risks from social harms like bias and misinformation through to the most extreme risks of all," Sunak said in a speech in London.翻译:该研究所“将推进世界对人工智能安全的了解，并将仔细检查、评估和测试新型人工智能，以便我们了解每种新模型的能力，探索从偏见和错误信息等社会危害到其中最极端的风险，”苏纳克在伦敦的一次演讲中说道。

Reporting by William James; Writing by William Schomberg翻译:威廉·詹姆斯报道；威廉·朔姆伯格撰写
item.author: Reuters

item.title: 科技公司警告称，德国对华出口因海关处理缓慢而受到打击
item.description:
German technology groups have warned they are being hit by delays in getting China-bound exports through customs, following the introduction of a German government strategy to reduce economic dependence on demand from China.翻译:德国科技集团警告称，在德国政府推出减少经济对中国需求依赖的战略后，它们正受到中国出口产品通关延误的打击。

German chip-making kit supplier Suess MicroTec (SMHNn.DE) late on Wednesday cut its sales forecasts for the second time in three months, blaming tightened controls for exports to China.翻译:德国芯片制造套件供应商Suess MicroTec (SMHNn.DE)周三晚间三个月内第二次下调销售预期，并将其归咎于对中国出口管制的收紧。

That sent shares in the maker of lithography equipment and other chipmaking gear tumbling 11% immediately after the statement and another 12% on Thursday.翻译:这导致该光刻设备和其他芯片制造设备制造商的股价在该声明发布后立即下跌 11%，周四又下跌 12%。

Suess said deliveries worth 23.5 million euros ($25 million) were stuck at customs. Though trade rules had not changed, customs have significantly stepped up their inspections since August, it added.翻译:Suess表示，价值2350万欧元（2500万美元）的货物被滞留在海关。报告补充称，尽管贸易规则没有改变，但海关自八月以来大幅加强了检查。

A spokesperson for German customs said they could not comment on specific cases, but that inspections were always conducted in a targeted fashion to avoid causing unnecessary delays. "We cannot confirm these statements about exports from Germany," the spokesperson added.翻译:德国海关发言人表示，他们无法对具体案件发表评论，但检查始终以有针对性的方式进行，以避免造成不必要的延误。 “我们无法证实这些有关德国出口的说法，”发言人补充道。

The Federal Office for Economic Affairs and Export Control (BAFA) did not immediately respond to a request for comment.翻译:联邦经济事务和出口管制办公室（BAFA）没有立即回应置评请求。

In July, the German government urged domestic firms to reduce their dependence on demand from China as part of a strategy of "de-risking" its economic relationship with the country.翻译:7月，德国政府敦促国内企业减少对中国需求的依赖，作为“降低与德国经济关系风险”战略的一部分。

Lobby group Asia-Pacific Committee of German Business (APA) told Reuters the BAFA office was appearing to scrutinise export requests more closely or escalate requests to the economy ministry more often.翻译:游说团体德国商业亚太委员会 (APA) 告诉路透社，BAFA 办公室似乎更仔细地审查出口请求，或更频繁地将请求升级给经济部。

PROCESSING DELAYS

"Manufacturers from all relevant industries have complained for several months of delays in the processing of export requests," said APA Managing Director Friedolin Strack, noting companies have stepped up efforts to obtain a type of export certificate to declare products unobjectionable.翻译:APA 常务董事 Friedolin Strack 表示：“所有相关行业的制造商都在抱怨出口请求处理延迟了好几个月。”他指出，各公司已加紧努力获得某种类型的出口证书，以声明产品无异议。

Unlisted technology group Trumpf, with about 4.2 billion euros ($4.4 billion) in revenue, said it was affected in a similar fashion.翻译:收入约为 42 亿欧元（44 亿美元）的非上市科技集团 Trumpf 表示，它也受到了类似的影响。

"We register in general that exports to China of high-tech products, which include our lasers, are being reviewed more thoroughly than in previous years," said a spokesperson.翻译:一位发言人表示：“总的来说，我们对向中国出口的高科技产品（包括我们的激光器）进行了比往年更彻底的审查。”

Trumpf makes lasers for Dutch maker of semiconductor manufacturing gear ASML (ASML.AS).翻译:Trumpf 为荷兰半导体制造设备制造商 ASML (ASML.AS)生产激光器。

Suess CEO Burkhardt Frick told Reuters it was largely left in the dark about the cause of delays, adding that customs officers were escalating more requests to BAFA, which has not turned down any but processing times there take between two to five months.翻译:Suess首席执行官伯克哈特·弗里克(Burkhardt Frick)对路透社表示，公司对延误的原因基本上一无所知，并补充说，海关官员正在向BAFA提交更多请求，BAFA没有拒绝任何请求，但处理时间需要两到五个月的时间。

"Our customers' patience is wearing thin but in the short term there is no alternative," said the CEO.翻译:“我们的客户的耐心正在消失，但短期内别无选择，”首席执行官表示。

Some high-tech companies with Chinese customers said they were not affected. Siltronic (WAFGn.DE), a maker of semiconductor wafers, said it was able to meet customs requirements, while Aixtron (AIXGn.DE) said it had allayed customs concerns early this year by adjusting its gear to rule out use in 5G wireless networks and radar.翻译:一些拥有中国客户的高科技公司表示，他们没有受到影响。半导体晶圆制造商 Siltronic (WAFGn.DE)表示能够满足海关要求，而 Aixtron (AIXGn.DE)则表示，今年年初通过调整设备以排除在 5G 无线网络中使用的情况，缓解了海关的担忧和雷达。

Still, the German chamber of commerce said the political environment was hobbling exports to China.翻译:尽管如此，德国商会表示，政治环境阻碍了对中国的出口。

"You really do wonder who is capable of providing all the (requested) data," its Managing Director Martin Wansleben told a press conference on Thursday.翻译:“你确实想知道谁有能力提供所有（要求的）数据，”其董事总经理马丁·万斯莱本（Martin Wansleben）在周四的新闻发布会上表示。

($1 = 0.9485 euros)翻译:（1 美元 = 0.9485 欧元）

Reporting by Alexander Huebner in Munich, Rene Wagner, Christian Kraemer and Thomas Escritt in Berlin, Anneli Palmen in Duesseldorf, and Ludwig Burger in Frankfurt; Editing by David Holmes翻译:Alexander Huebner 在慕尼黑、Rene Wagner、Christian Kraemer 和 Thomas Escritt 在柏林、Anneli Palmen 在杜塞尔多夫以及 Ludwig Burger 在法兰克福报道；编辑：大卫·霍姆斯

item.title: 欧盟为全球南方制定项目以与中国竞争
item.description:
The European Union concluded a two-day forum on Thursday designed to woo the Global South with 3 billion euros ($3.16 billion) of signed investments in infrastructure, digital and climate projects as an alternative to China's rival scheme.翻译:欧盟于周四结束了为期两天的论坛，旨在吸引全球南方国家签署30亿欧元（31.6亿美元）的基础设施、数字和气候项目投资，作为中国竞争对手计划的替代方案。

The EU's Global Gateway is designed to invest 300 billion euros, half of it in Africa, from 2021 to 2027.翻译:欧盟全球门户计划从2021年到2027年投资3000亿欧元，其中一半投向非洲。

The projects are in areas such as energy, transport, education and research, along with partnerships to help the European Union secure minerals critical for its green transition and reduce reliance on China.翻译:这些项目涉及能源、交通、教育和研究等领域，并建立伙伴关系，帮助欧盟获得对其绿色转型至关重要的矿产资源，并减少对中国的依赖。

Partnerships sealed during the two-day forum included one with Mauritania on green hydrogen and with Uzbekistan and Zambia on critical raw materials.翻译:在为期两天的论坛期间达成的合作伙伴关系包括与毛里塔尼亚在绿色氢方面的合作以及与乌兹别克斯坦和赞比亚在关键原材料方面的合作。

The Global Gateway Forum came a week after China hosted a 10th anniversary celebration of the Belt and Road Initiative (BRI), where $97.2 billion worth of projects were signed.翻译:全球门户论坛召开一周前，中国举办了“ 一带一路”倡议十周年庆祝活动，签署了价值 972 亿美元的项目。

Critics say some of China's infrastructure lending has saddled poor countries with loans they cannot repay.翻译:批评人士称，中国的一些基础设施贷款让贫穷国家承担了无法偿还的贷款。

EU officials say the Global Gateway ensures local communities benefit from infrastructure projects and promotes high social and environmental standards.翻译:欧盟官员表示，全球门户确保当地社区从基础设施项目中受益，并促进高社会和环境标准。

"We want to de-risk, we want to reduce dependencies.... but we hear similar objectives and aims from our partners," Jutta Urpilainen, European Commissioner for International Partnerships, told journalists.翻译:“我们想要降低风险，我们想要减少依赖性......但我们从我们的合作伙伴那里听到了类似的目标，”欧盟国际伙伴关系专员尤塔·乌尔皮莱宁（Jutta Urpilainen）告诉记者。

The commissioner said the EU was the world's largest provider of oversees development aid, the biggest investor in and trade partner of Africa and other parts of the world.翻译:这位专员表示，欧盟是世界上最大的监督发展援助提供者、非洲和世界其他地区最大的投资者和贸易伙伴。

"Bringing all this together, I'm very confident that we will be able to strengthen our global role and be more efficient, more strategic and a more important global player," she said.翻译:她说：“将所有这些结合在一起，我非常有信心我们将能够加强我们的全球作用，并成为更高效、更具战略性和更重要的全球参与者。”

Urpilainen said her talks with African countries showed many did not want more loans but wanted to work with the EU, although at times wanted it to move faster.翻译:乌尔皮莱宁表示，她与非洲国家的会谈表明，许多国家不希望获得更多贷款，而是希望与欧盟合作，尽管有时希望行动更快。

($1 = 0.9482 euros)翻译:（1 美元 = 0.9482 欧元）

Reporting by Philip Blenkinsop翻译:菲利普·布伦金索普报道

item.title: 中国称美国无权介入中菲问题
item.description:
The United States does not have the right to get involved in problems between China and the Philippines, the Chinese foreign ministry said on Thursday, as tensions simmer over conflicts in disputed waters of the South China Sea.翻译:中国外交部周四表示，美国无权介入中国和菲律宾之间的问题，因为南海争议海域的冲突引发紧张局势。

"The U.S. is not party to the South China Sea issue, it has no right to get involved in a problem between China and the Philippines," said ministry spokesperson Mao Ning at a regular press briefing when asked about the U.S. saying it will defend the Philippines.翻译:当被问及美国表示将捍卫南海问题时，外交部发言人毛宁在例行记者会上表示：“美国不是南海问题当事方，无权介入中菲之间的问题。”菲律宾。

China and the Philippines have had several high-profile confrontations in the South China Sea, most notably in disputed waters around the Second Thomas Shoal, part of the Spratly Islands.翻译:中国和菲律宾在南海发生了几次引人注目的对抗，尤其是在仁爱礁（南沙群岛的一部分）周围有争议的海域。

Last Sunday, a Chinese vessel collided with a Philippine boat, with Manila condemning "in the strongest degree" the "dangerous blocking manoeuvres" of the vessel.翻译:上周日，一艘中国船只与一艘菲律宾船只相撞，马尼拉“最强烈地”谴责该船的“危险拦截动作”。

"The U.S. promise of defending the Philippines must not hurt China's sovereignty and maritime interests in the South China Sea, and it also must not enable and encourage the illegal claims of the Philippines," Mao said.翻译:毛泽东说：“美国保卫菲律宾的承诺不能损害中国在南海的主权和海洋利益，也不能纵容和鼓励菲律宾的非法主张。”

A spokesperson for the Philippine foreign ministry did not immediately respond to a request for comment.翻译:菲律宾外交部发言人没有立即回应置评请求。

U.S. President Joe Biden said on Wednesday at the White House that America's commitment to Philippines defence remains "iron-clad," after accusing China of acting "dangerously and unlawfully" in the South China Sea.翻译:美国总统乔·拜登周三在白宫指责中国在南海采取“危险且非法”的行为后，表示美国对菲律宾防务的承诺仍然是“铁定的”。

"Any attack on the Filipino aircraft, vessels, or armed forces will invoke ... our Mutual Defence Treaty with the Philippines," Biden said in remarks during a joint meeting with Australia's prime minister.翻译:拜登在与澳大利亚总理的联合会议上表示：“对菲律宾飞机、船只或武装部队的任何攻击都将援引……我们与菲律宾的共同防御条约。”

The United States and the Philippines recently agreed on new guidelines for their 1951 Mutual Defence Treaty. The guidelines now specifically mention that mutual defence commitments would be invoked if there were an armed attack on either country “anywhere in the South China Sea”.翻译:美国和菲律宾最近就 1951 年共同防御条约的新指导方针达成一致。该指导方针现在特别提到，如果“南海任何地方”对任何一个国家进行武装袭击，都将援引共同防御承诺。

Reporting by Eduardo Baptista and Bernard Orr; Editing by Muralikumar Anantharaman and Michael Perry翻译:爱德华多·巴普蒂斯塔和伯纳德·奥尔报道；穆拉利库马尔·阿南塔拉曼和迈克尔·佩里编辑
item.author: Reuters

item.title: 中国最年轻航天员启程前往空间站
item.description:
The youngest-ever crew of Chinese astronauts departed for China's space station on Thursday, paving the way for a new generation of "taikonauts" to advance the country's space ambitions in the future.翻译:周四，有史以来最年轻的中国航天员启程前往中国空间站，为新一代“航天员”推进中国未来的太空雄心铺平了道路。

The spacecraft Shenzhou-17, or "Divine Vessel", and its three passengers lifted off atop a Long March-2F rocket from the Jiuquan Satellite Launch Centre in northwest China.翻译:神舟十七号飞船及其三名乘客乘坐长征二号F火箭从中国西北部的酒泉卫星发射中心升空。

Leading the six-month mission was former air force pilot Tang Hongbo, 48, who was on the first crewed mission to the space station in 2021.翻译:领导这项为期六个月的任务的是 48 岁的前空军飞行员唐洪波，他于 2021 年执行了首次载人空间站任务。

His return to the orbiting outpost Tiangong, or "Celestial Palace" in Chinese, also set a new record for the shortest interval between two spaceflight missions by taikonauts - coined from the Chinese word for space - suggesting a faster rotation of taikonauts in coming years.翻译:他返回轨道前哨站天宫，也创下了航天员两次航天任务之间最短间隔的新纪录，这意味着未来几年航天员的轮换速度会更快。

Tang, from China's second batch of astronauts in 2010, had to wait more than a decade before he was picked for his inaugural spaceflight in 2021.翻译:唐是2010年中国第二批航天员，等了十多年才被选中参加2021年的首次航天飞行。

By contrast, his fellow Shenzhou-17 crew members Tang Shengjie, 33, and Jiang Xinlin, 35, both travelling to space for the first time, joined China's third batch of astronauts in September 2020.翻译:相比之下，神舟十七号机组成员唐胜杰（33岁）和蒋新林（35岁）都是首次进入太空，于2020年9月加入中国第三批航天员。

China has already kickstarted the selection process for the fourth batch of astronauts, seeking candidates with doctoral degrees in disciplines from biology, physics and chemistry to biomedical engineering and astronomy.翻译:中国已经启动了第四批航天员的选拔工作，寻找具有生物学、物理化学、生物医学工程和天文学等学科博士学位的候选人。

It is also opening the process to applicants from Hong Kong and Macau for the first time.翻译:它还首次向香港和澳门的申请人开放该流程。

The first and second batches of astronauts were all former air force pilots, like Tang, who joined the People's Liberation Army in 1995 at age 20.翻译:第一批和第二批宇航员都是前空军飞行员，比如唐，1995年20岁时加入解放军。

FOREIGN ASTRONAUTS

The selection and training process will commence soon for foreign astronauts looking to participate in joint flights to Tiangong, a senior official on China's manned space program said this year.翻译:中国载人航天计划的一位高级官员今年表示，对于希望参加天宫联合飞行的外国宇航员的选拔和培训过程即将开始。

But as much as China is showcasing its efforts to internationalise its space missions, its space program has distinct Chinese characteristics, at least on Tiangong.翻译:但尽管中国正在展示其太空任务国际化的努力，但其太空计划具有鲜明的中国特色，至少在天宫上是这样。

In a departure from the NASA-led International Space Station (ISS), where English is the working language, only Chinese is used on Tiangong, making Chinese-language skills a key criteria for foreign participants.翻译:与美国宇航局领导的国际空间站（ISS）以英语为工作语言不同，天宫号上只使用中文，这使得中文能力成为外国参与者的关键标准。

Tiangong has become a symbol of China's growing confidence in its space endeavours after being shut out of the ISS program for decades. China is banned by U.S. law from any collaboration, direct or indirect, with NASA.翻译:在被排除在国际空间站计划之外数十年后，天宫号已成为中国对其太空事业信心不断增强的象征。美国法律禁止中国与美国宇航局进行任何直接或间接的合作。

Tiangong, completed in late 2022, can house a maximum of three astronauts at an orbital altitude of up to 450 km (280 miles) and will have an operational lifespan of more than 15 years.翻译:天宫号于 2022 年底竣工，最多可容纳三名宇航员，轨道高度高达 450 公里（280 英里）， 使用寿命将超过 15 年。

The Shenzhou-17 astronauts will replace the Shenzhou-16 crew, who arrived at Tiangong at the end of May.翻译:神舟十七号航天员将接替五月底抵达天宫的神舟十六号宇航员。

The Shenzhou-16 crew, consisting of veteran astronaut Jing Haipeng, Zhu Yangzhu and Gui Haichao, is scheduled to return to earth on Oct. 31.翻译:由老航天员景海鹏、朱扬柱、桂海超组成的神舟十六号机组人员计划于10月31日返回地球。

Zhu and Gui, both in their 30s, are from China's third batch of astronauts.翻译:朱和桂都是30多岁的人，都是中国第三批航天员。

Shenzhou-17 marks China's 12th crewed mission since Yang Liwei's solo spaceflight in October 2003, the first Chinese national in space.翻译:神舟十七号是继2003年10月杨利伟单人航天飞行之后中国第12次载人飞行任务，杨利伟是中国第一个进入太空的人。

item.title: 中国月球研究站计划的伙伴国家
item.description:
Belarus this week joined China's International Lunar Research Station (ILRS) programme, the third country to sign up this month for a plan to eventually set up a permanently inhabited outpost on the moon's south pole.翻译:白俄罗斯本周加入了中国的国际月球研究站（ILRS）计划，这是本月签署计划的第三个国家，该计划最终将在月球南极建立一个永久居住的前哨基地。

Earlier in October, Pakistan and Azerbaijan joined the ILRS, a project jointly initiated by China and Russia in 2021 and widely seen as a rival to the U.S.-led Artemis programme.翻译:10 月初，巴基斯坦和阿塞拜疆加入了 ILRS，该项目由中国和俄罗斯于 2021 年联合发起，被广泛视为美国主导的阿尔忒弥斯计划的竞争对手。

Lunar missions this decade will establish a "basic" version of the research station, followed by more missions in the 2030s to construct a "full" version of the base.翻译:这十年的探月任务将建立一个“基本”版本的研究站，随后在 2030 年代将进行更多任务，以建造一个“完整”版本的基地。

By 2050, the ILRS is expected to be a fully operational station for lunar research, and potentially also a launch pad for crewed missions to other planets in the solar system.翻译:到 2050 年，ILRS 预计将成为月球研究的全面运行站，也有可能成为前往太阳系其他行星的载人任务的发射台。

Note: (*) denotes founding member翻译:注：(*)表示创始成员

Reporting by Ryan Woo; Editing by Emelia Sithole-Matarise翻译:瑞恩·吴 (Ryan Woo) 报道；编辑：埃米莉亚·西托尔-马塔里斯

item.title: 中国称石墨出口限制并非针对特定行业
item.description:
China's commerce ministry said on Thursday that recently announced restrictions on graphite exports are not targeted at any specific sector.翻译:中国商务部周四表示，最近宣布的石墨出口限制不针对任何特定行业。

A ministry spokeswoman was responding to a question at a regular briefing on the purpose of measures requiring export licences for some graphite products from Dec. 1.翻译:该部发言人在例行新闻发布会上回答了有关从 12 月 1 日起对某些石墨产品要求出口许可证的措施的目的的问题。

item.title: 英国副首相：中国接受英国人工智能峰会邀请
item.description:
China has accepted Britain's invitation to attend a global summit on artificial intelligence next week, Deputy Prime Minister Oliver Dowden said on Thursday.翻译:英国副首相奥利弗·道登周四表示，中国已接受英国邀请，出席下周举行的全球人工智能峰会。

"It is the case they've accepted, but we will wait to see everyone who actually turns up at the summit," Dowden told the BBC. "As things stands, yes, we do expect them to come."翻译:道登告诉英国广播公司：“他们已经接受了这种情况，但我们将等待看到真正出现在峰会上的每个人。” “就目前情况而言，是的，我们确实希望他们来。”

Britain is bringing together representatives of AI companies, political leaders and experts on Nov. 1-2 to discuss what some see as the risks posed by AI, with an aim of building an international consensus on its safe development.翻译:英国将于 11 月 1 日至 2 日召集人工智能公司代表、政治领导人和专家，讨论一些人认为的人工智能带来的风险，旨在就人工智能的安全发展达成国际共识。

Reporting by William James and Muvija M Editing by William Schomberg翻译:William James 和 Muvija M 报道 William Schomberg 编辑
item.author: Reuters

item.title: 中美会面为拜登-习近平峰会铺平道路，中东成为焦点
item.description:
Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi begins a long-anticipated visit to Washington on Thursday, as the U.S. and China seek to manage deep strategic differences and pave the way for an expected summit between presidents Joe Biden and Xi Jinping.翻译:中国外交部长王毅周四开始对华盛顿进行期待已久的访问，美国和中国寻求管理深刻的战略分歧，并为预期的乔·拜登总统和习近平总统之间的峰会铺平道路。

The Middle East war has added a fresh dynamic to the testy relationship between the superpowers and Washington is hoping Beijing could use its influence with Iran to help ensure the Israel-Hamas conflict does not spread to the wider region.翻译:中东战争给超级大国之间紧张的关系增添了新的活力，华盛顿希望北京能够利用其对伊朗的影响力来帮助确保以色列与哈马斯的冲突不会蔓延到更广泛的地区。

However, while both Beijing and Washington have spoken of looking for areas where they can work together, and Xi on Wednesday said China was willing to cooperate on global challenges, experts do not expect immediate progress.翻译:然而，尽管北京和华盛顿都谈到寻找可以合作的领域，而且习近平周三表示中国愿意就全球挑战进行合作，但专家预计不会立即取得进展。

The Biden administration's priority with Beijing has been to prevent intense competition between the world's two largest economies and disagreements on a host of issues from trade to Taiwan and the South China Sea veering into conflict.翻译:拜登政府与北京的首要任务是防止世界两大经济体之间的激烈竞争，以及防止在贸易、台湾和南海等一系列问题上的分歧演变成冲突。

U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken will welcome Wang at the State Department on Thursday, and he told the U.N. Security Council on Tuesday he would work with him to prevent the Middle East conflict from spreading.翻译:美国国务卿安东尼·布林肯将于周四在国务院欢迎王毅，并于周二向联合国安理会表示，他将与王毅合作，防止中东冲突蔓延。

Policy analysts in China and the U.S. say both sides share an interest in averting a wider war and that China, as a major oil purchaser, has considerable influence it could exert on Iran.翻译:中国和美国的政策分析人士表示，避免更广泛的战争符合双方的共同利益，而且中国作为主要石油购买国，可以对伊朗施加相当大的影响。

But whether Beijing will use it remains to be seen and experts say China may instead watch from the sidelines for a while longer.翻译:但北京是否会使用它还有待观察，专家表示，中国可能会继续观望一段时间。

"The Chinese certainly have an interest in preventing a direct U.S.-Iranian confrontation, as they are major oil consumers and that would spike prices," said Jon Alterman, head of the Middle East program at Washington's Center for Strategic and International Studies.翻译:华盛顿战略与国际研究中心中东项目负责人乔恩·奥尔特曼表示：“中国当然有兴趣阻止美伊直接对抗，因为他们是主要石油消费国，这会导致油价上涨。”

"Still, the Chinese are unlikely to do any heavy lifting here. I expect they'll want a seat at the table when the Israel-Gaza struggle gets resolved, but they don't feel much need or ability to hasten resolution."翻译:“不过，中国人不太可能在这里做任何繁重的工作。我预计，当以色列和加沙的斗争得到解决时，他们会希望在谈判桌上占有一席之地，但他们觉得没有太大的必要或能力来加速解决。”

WANG, BIDEN

Shi Yinhong, professor of international relations at Renmin University of China, said Beijing exerting its influence over Iran was "almost the only serious and practical U.S. expectation of China on the Middle East situation."翻译:中国人民大学国际关系教授时殷弘表示，北京对伊朗施加影响“几乎是美国对中国在中东局势上唯一严肃而实际的期望”。

However Shi added: "The U.S. position on Iran is far from acceptable to China and vice versa. Mutual compromise on this issue could be too limited and small to be of any significance."翻译:但史补充道：“美国在伊朗问题上的立场远不能为中国所接受，反之亦然。在这个问题上的相互妥协可能太有限、太小，没有任何意义。”

Washington has stressed the importance of China's ability to influence Iran. Blinken, during a whirlwind Middle East trip last week, spoke by phone to Wang and asked him to use Beijing's clout to ensure the conflict does not widen.翻译:华盛顿强调了中国影响伊朗的能力的重要性。布林肯上周在中东之行期间与王通电话，要求他利用北京的影响力确保冲突不会扩大。

China has called for restraint and a ceasefire in response to Israel's bombardment of Gaza in retaliation for an Oct. 7 attack by Hamas that Israel says killed 1,400 people. Retaliatory Israeli airstrikes have killed over 6,500 people, the health ministry in Hamas-ruled Gaza said on Wednesday. Reuters has not been able to independently verify the casualty figures of either side.翻译:中国呼吁各方保持克制并停火，以回应以色列对加沙的轰炸，以报复哈马斯 10 月 7 日发动的袭击，以色列称此次袭击造成 1,400 人死亡。哈马斯统治的加沙卫生部周三表示，以色列的报复性空袭已造成 6,500 多人死亡。路透社尚未能够独立核实双方的伤亡数字。

"China has been working tirelessly to promote the cessation of hostilities and the restoration of peace. We have been maintaining close communication with the parties concerned," China's U.N. Ambassador Zhang Jun said on Tuesday.翻译:中国驻联合国大使张军周二表示：“中国一直在为推动停止敌对行动、恢复和平作出不懈努力。我们一直与有关各方保持着密切沟通。”

Wang's visit to Washington comes after several top U.S. officials, including Blinken, visited Beijing in the past several months.翻译:王毅此次访问华盛顿之前，包括布林肯在内的多位美国高级官员在过去几个月访问了北京。

The veteran Chinese diplomat is expected to meet Biden's national security adviser, Jake Sullivan, on Friday. He is also expected to speak with Biden during his visit to the White House, according to two U.S. officials, although it is unclear how substantial their interaction will be.翻译:这位资深的中国外交官预计将于周五会见拜登的国家安全顾问杰克·沙利文。两名美国官员表示，预计他还将在拜登访问白宫期间与他进行交谈，尽管目前尚不清楚他们的互动会有多大。

PATH TO BIDEN-XI MEETING

Analysts expect the discussions to focus on preparations for an anticipated meeting between Biden and Xi on the sidelines of the summit of Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) countries in San Francisco from Nov. 11 to 17. It would be Biden and Xi's first in-person meeting since a summit in Bali last November.翻译:分析人士预计，讨论的重点将是拜登和习近平将于 11 月 11 日至 17 日在旧金山举行的亚太经合组织 (APEC) 国家峰会期间举行的会晤的准备工作。这将是拜登和习近平的首次会面。自去年 11 月巴厘岛峰会以来，人们一直在聚会。

"There are substantive things to be ironed out and finalized," said Yun Sun, director of the China Program at Washington's Stimson Center. "(Wang) will be here for the negotiations only - the big deliverables will be reserved for the top leaders to announce."翻译:华盛顿史汀生中心中国项目主任孙云表示，“有一些实质性的事情需要解决和敲定。” “（王）来这里只是为了谈判——重要的成果将留待最高领导人宣布。”

On Wednesday, Xi said whether Washington and Beijing could establish the "right" way of getting along and managing their differences would be crucial to the world.翻译:周三，习近平表示，华盛顿和北京能否建立“正确”的相处方式并管理分歧，对世界至关重要。

The two sides go into APEC from different economic perspectives, with economic policy analysts saying the U.S. has weathered challenging global conditions after the COVID-19 pandemic somewhat better than China.翻译:双方从不同的经济角度讨论 APEC，经济政策分析师表示，在 COVID-19 大流行之后，美国在应对充满挑战的全球形势方面比中国要好一些。

U.S. and Chinese officials held a virtual meeting on Monday on macroeconomic developments, talks the U.S. called "productive and substantive" and China called "in-depth, frank and constructive."翻译:美国和中国官员周一就宏观经济发展举行了一次虚拟会议，美国称会谈“富有成效和实质性”，中国称会谈“深入、坦诚和建设性”。

U.S. officials said Taiwan and the South and East China Seas, where they accused Beijing of "destabilizing and dangerous actions" against rival territorial claimants, would also be on the agenda.翻译:美国官员表示，台湾和南海和东海问题也将被列入议程，他们指责北京针对敌对领土主张者采取“破坏稳定和危险的行动”。

They said re-establishing military-to-military ties with China remained a top U.S. priority to avoid unintended conflict.翻译:他们表示，与中国重建军事关系仍然是美国的首要任务，以避免意外冲突。

China's Global Times tabloid highlighted contradictions in relations.翻译:中国的《环球时报》小报强调了两国关系中的矛盾。

"Although Sino-U.S. interactions have seen a rapid recovery in different fields," the U.S. policy of attempting to "contain" China had not changed, it said, accusing Washington of "two-faced tactics" in which it "frequently takes various opportunities to discredit China and create friction."翻译:文章称，“虽然中美在不同领域的互动迅速恢复”，但美国试图“遏制”中国的政策没有改变，并指责华盛顿“频繁利用各种机会”，采取“双面策略”。抹黑中国、制造摩擦。”

Reporting by Humeyra Pamuk and David Brunnstrom in Washington and Laurie Chen in Beijing; Additional reporting by Trevor Hunnicutt Editing by Josie Kao翻译:Humeyra Pamuk 和 David Brunnstrom 在华盛顿以及 Laurie Chen 在北京的报道； Trevor Hunnicutt 的补充报道 Josie Kao 编辑

item.title: 台湾报告有15架中国空军飞机进入其防空区
item.description:
Taiwan's defence ministry said that it had detected 15 Chinese air force planes entering Taiwan's air defence zone on Thursday morning, including fighter jets and drones, accompanying Chinese warships carrying out "combat readiness patrols" and drills.翻译:台湾国防部表示，周四上午发现15架中国空军飞机进入台湾防空区，其中包括战斗机和无人机，伴随中国军舰进行“战备巡逻”和演习。

Taiwan, which China claims as its own territory, has repeatedly complained over the past four years of Chinese military activity around the island.翻译:中国声称台湾是自己的领土，过去四年来，台湾多次抱怨中国在台湾周边的军事活动。

Reporting by Ben Blanchard Editing by Shri Navaratnam翻译:本·布兰查德 (Ben Blanchard) 报道 Shri Navaratnam 编辑
item.author: Reuters

item.title: 独家：消息人士称，拜登将于周五与中国最高外交官王毅通话
item.description:
President Joe Biden is expected to speak with Wang Yi when China's top diplomat visits the White House this week, according to two U.S. officials familiar with planning for the visit.翻译:据两名熟悉访问计划的美国官员透露，预计中国最高外交官王毅本周访问白宫时，乔·拜登总统将与王毅进行交谈。

Wang, who is set to meet Biden's national security adviser Jake Sullivan, at the White House on Friday could see Biden in person at that time, according to one of the people.翻译:据一位知情人士透露，王定于周五在白宫会见拜登的国家安全顾问杰克·沙利文，届时可能会亲自见到拜登。

The White House declined to comment.翻译:白宫拒绝发表评论。

It is unclear how substantial their interaction will be, but even an informal greeting would be Biden's senior-most interaction with the Chinese government since he briefly met Chinese President Xi Jinping's No. 2, Premier Li Qiang, on the sidelines of the G20 summit in New Delhi.翻译:目前尚不清楚他们的互动会有多实质性，但即使是一次非正式的问候，也将是拜登自 2017 年 G20 峰会期间短暂会见中国国家主席习近平的第二号总理李强以来与中国政府的最高级互动。新德里。

It comes as U.S. and Chinese officials set the stage for a long-sought, one-on-one meeting between Biden and Xi at November's Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit in San Francisco. Xi and Biden last met at a summit in Bali last November.翻译:在此之际，美国和中国官员正在为拜登和习近平在 11 月于旧金山举行的亚太经合组织 (APEC) 峰会上进行期待已久的一对一会晤做准备。习近平和拜登上次会面是在去年11月巴厘岛峰会上。

Wang is also set to meet Secretary of State Antony Blinken during his trip to Washington this Thursday through Saturday. Several top U.S. officials including Blinken met their Chinese counterparts in Beijing this summer.翻译:王毅还将于本周四至周六访问华盛顿期间会见国务卿安东尼·布林肯。今年夏天，包括布林肯在内的几位美国高级官员在北京会见了中国同行。

Wang is the top foreign affairs official in the Chinese Communist Party and also foreign minister since the dismissal of Qin Gang in July.翻译:王毅是中共最高外交官员，也是自7月秦刚被解职以来的外交部长。

Biden said during a press conference on Wednesday he plans to "compete" with China "according to the international rules - economically, politically, and other ways - but I'm not looking for conflict." He also warned Chinese officials against aggression toward the Philippines.翻译:拜登在周三的新闻发布会上表示，他计划“根据国际规则——经济、政治和其他方式——与中国“竞争”，但我并不寻求冲突。”他还警告中国官员不要侵略菲律宾。

For his part, Xi said on Wednesday China is willing to cooperate with the United States as both sides manage their differences and work together to respond to global challenges, according to Chinese state media.翻译:据中国官方媒体报道，习近平周三表示，中国愿意与美国合作，管控分歧，共同应对全球挑战。

Reporting by Trevor Hunnicutt; Editing by Heather Timmons and Lincoln Feast.翻译:特雷弗·亨尼卡特报道；希瑟·蒂蒙斯和林肯·盛宴编辑。
item.author: Trevor Hunnicutt

item.title: 美国在首次金融工作组会议上“坦诚提出”与中国的分歧
item.description:
U.S. officials "frankly raised areas of disagreement" with China at the first meeting of a new financial working group, where financial stability, supervision and regulation were discussed, the U.S. Treasury said on Wednesday.翻译:美国财政部周三表示，美国官员在新金融工作组的第一次会议上“坦率地提出了与中国的分歧领域”，会议讨论了金融稳定、监督和监管问题。

Attendees included senior officials from China's central bank and the U.S. Treasury Department, according to a Treasury statement.翻译:根据美国财政部的一份声明，与会者包括中国央行和美国财政部的高级官员。

"The two-hour virtual meeting included a substantive and wide-ranging discussion on domestic and global financial stability, financial supervision and regulation, sustainable finance, and anti-money laundering and countering the financing of terrorism," the Treasury said.翻译:美国财政部表示：“两个小时的虚拟会议就国内和全球金融稳定、金融监管、可持续金融、反洗钱和打击资助恐怖主义等问题进行了实质性和广泛的讨论。”

The financial working group and a parallel economic working group were launched last month after U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen's visit to Beijing in July aimed at fostering regular communications between the world's two largest economies.翻译:美国财政部长珍妮特·耶伦 (Janet Yellen) 7 月访问北京后， 上个月成立了金融工作组和平行经济工作组，旨在促进世界最大两个经济体之间的定期沟通。

The economic working group, led by senior officials from the Treasury and China's Finance Ministry held its first meeting on Monday.翻译:由财政部和中国财政部高级官员领导的经济工作组周一举行了第一次会议。

Yellen met with People's Bank of China Governor Pan Gongsheng on Oct. 13 on the sidelines of International Monetary Fund and World Bank annual meetings in Marrakech, Morocco, and discussed debt issues plaguing developing economies and the global financial architecture.翻译:10月13日，耶伦在摩洛哥马拉喀什出席国际货币基金组织和世界银行年会期间会见中国人民银行行长潘功胜，双方讨论了困扰发展中经济体的债务问题和全球金融架构。

Yellen told Reuters in an interview that the discussion included a U.S.-backed plan to increase IMF quota-based lending resources without changes to its shareholding structure. China has been reluctant to support the funding increase without an increase in its IMF shares, but Yellen said the "equi-proportional" quota increase is "pretty likely" to succeed.翻译:耶伦在接受路透社采访时表示，讨论内容包括一项美国支持的计划，即在不改变其股权结构的情况下增加国际货币基金组织基于配额的贷款资源。中国一直不愿在不增加其国际货币基金组织份额的情况下支持增加资金，但耶伦表示，“等比例”配额增加“很有可能”成功。

item.title: 爱沙尼亚重点关注中国船只，调查水下电缆损坏情况
item.description:
Estonia's investigation into a damaged Baltic Sea telecoms cable will focus on the actions of a Chinese-owned vessel, the country's prosecutor general said, after Finland blamed damage to a nearby pipeline on a ship.翻译:爱沙尼亚总检察长表示，在芬兰指责一艘船只损坏了附近的管道后，爱沙尼亚对波罗的海电信电缆受损的调查将重点关注一艘中国船只的行为。

Early on Oct. 8, a gas pipeline and a telecoms cable connecting Finland and Estonia under the Baltic Sea were broken. Another telecoms cable, between Sweden and Estonia, was also damaged that night.翻译:10月8日早些时候，波罗的海海底连接芬兰和爱沙尼亚的一条天然气管道和一条电信电缆破裂。当晚，瑞典和爱沙尼亚之间的另一条电信电缆也被损坏。

Finnish investigators said on Tuesday that they had found a large anchor near the pipeline, which they believe was broken as a ship dragged the anchor along the seabed.翻译:芬兰调查人员周二表示，他们在管道附近发现了一个大锚，他们认为，当一艘船沿着海底拖动锚时，该锚已破裂。

They named the Chinese-owned and Hong-Kong-flagged container carrier NewNew Polar Bear as the prime suspect.翻译:他们将悬挂香港国旗的中资集装箱运输公司NewNew Polar Bear列为主要嫌疑人。

Helsinki is investigating the pipeline incident, while Tallinn is looking into the cables incidents.翻译:赫尔辛基正在调查管道事件，塔林正在调查电缆事件。

The spokesperson for Estonia's general prosecutor said the investigation into the damage to the Estonia-Finland cable is moving its focus to the same vessel, despite the cable being located "somewhat further" from the pipeline.翻译:爱沙尼亚总检察长发言人表示，对爱沙尼亚-芬兰电缆受损情况的调查正在将重点转移到同一艘船上，尽管该电缆距离管道“稍远”。

"The aim of the investigation is still to determine whether the vessel is responsible for damaging the telecommunications cables or not, and whether the damage was caused intentionally or by accident," he added.翻译:他补充说：“调查的目的仍然是确定该船是否对损坏电信电缆负有责任，以及损坏是故意还是意外造成的。”

Reuters reported that two vessels, NewNew Polar Bear and Russia-flagged Sevmorput, were present at all three sites around the time of the damage, according to data from MarineTraffic, a ship-tracking and maritime analytics provider.翻译:路透社报道称，根据船舶跟踪和海事分析提供商 MarineTraffic 的数据，在损坏发生时，两艘船 NewNew Polar Bear 和悬挂俄罗斯国旗的 Sevmorput 出现在所有三个地点。

"I hope we will receive the necessary support from China to make constructive contact with the crew and owners of the ship," Estonia's Foreign Affairs Minister Margus Tsahkna said on Tuesday.翻译:爱沙尼亚外交部长马古斯·查克纳周二表示：“我希望我们能得到中国的必要支持，以便与船员和船东进行建设性接触。”

On Monday, China called for an "objective, fair and professional" investigation into the gas pipeline damage.翻译:周一，中国呼吁对天然气管道受损事件进行“客观、公正、专业”的调查。

"It is understood that the Chinese vessel was normal in the relevant waters at the time of the incident, and no abnormalities were found due to the poor sea conditions at that time," a Chinese foreign ministry spokesperson told reporters.翻译:中国外交部发言人对记者表示：“据了解，事发时中方船只在有关海域一切正常，因当时海况较差，未发现异常情况。”

Reporting by Andrius Sytas in Vilnius; Editing by Sharon Singleton翻译:Andrius Sytas 在维尔纽斯的报道；莎朗·辛格尔顿编辑
item.author: Andrius Sytas

item.title: 中国与美国亲密盟友哥伦比亚升级外交关系
item.description:
Summary:
  • China, Colombia elevate ties to strategic partnership翻译:中国与哥伦比亚将关系提升为战略伙伴关系
  • Colombia is one of closest U.S. allies in Latin America翻译:哥伦比亚是美国在拉丁美洲最亲密的盟友之一
  • Colombia yet to join Xi's Belt and Road Initiative翻译:哥伦比亚尚未加入习近平的“一带一路”倡议

China elevated diplomatic relations with Colombia to a strategic partnership on Wednesday, deepening a push with one of the oldest U.S. allies to expand its influence and strengthen its foothold in Latin America.翻译:中国周三将与哥伦比亚的外交关系提升为战略伙伴关系，深化与美国最古老的盟友之一的合作，以扩大其影响力并加强其在拉丁美洲的立足点。

The two countries upgraded their relations, first established in 1980, as Colombian President Gustavo Petro met his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping on a visit to Beijing this week, his first to the world's second-largest economy since assuming office last year.翻译:两国升级了自 1980 年首次建立的关系，哥伦比亚总统古斯塔沃·佩特罗 (Gustavo Petro) 本周访问北京时会见了中国国家主席习近平，这是他自去年上任以来首次访问世界第二大经济体。

The upgrade of relations with Colombia means China now has strategic ties with 10 out of the 11 South American countries with which it has relations. Guyana is the only country in the region with which it has ordinary bilateral ties.翻译:与哥伦比亚关系升级意味着中国与11个南美国家中的10个建立了战略关系。圭亚那是该地区唯一与其建立正常双边关系的国家。

China in recent years has stepped up a charm offensive in South America, Central America and the Caribbean, a region of strategic significance for arch-rival the United States.翻译:近年来，中国加大了对南美、中美洲和加勒比地区的魅力攻势，这些地区对美国的主要竞争对手具有战略意义。

The region is also significant to China as it hosts a handful of countries that have no ties with Beijing but instead recognise democratically governed Taiwan as a sovereign state. Paraguay is the last South American nation that has ties with Taiwan, which China claims as part of its territory.翻译:该地区对中国也很重要，因为它拥有少数与北京没有关系但承认民主治理的台湾为主权国家的国家。巴拉圭是最后一个与台湾有关系的南美国家，中国声称台湾是其领土的一部分。

During the COVID pandemic, China was the first country that sent vaccines to Colombia. In 2021, in recognition of China's help in fighting the coronavirus, Xi was invited to give a speech via video link to the people of Colombia.翻译:新冠疫情期间，中国是第一个向哥伦比亚运送疫苗的国家。 2021年，为表彰中国为抗击新冠病毒所提供的帮助，习近平应邀向哥伦比亚人民发表视频讲话。

Chinese imports from Colombia have risen sharply in the last few years, becoming the South American nation's second-biggest trading partner after the United States. In 2022, shipments from Colombia to China totalled $7 billion, up almost 20% from five years earlier.翻译:过去几年，中国从哥伦比亚的进口大幅增长，成为该南美国家仅次于美国的第二大贸易伙伴。 2022年，哥伦比亚向中国出口总额达70亿美元，比五年前增长近20%。

The two countries signed 12 cooperation deals during the visit, Petro's office said in a statement, including one allowing Colombian beef imports from next year and another allowing shipments of quinoa, as well as the establishment of several working groups meant to improve commerce.翻译:石油公司办公室在一份声明中表示，两国在访问期间签署了 12 项合作协议，其中一项允许从明年开始进口哥伦比亚牛肉，另一项允许装运藜麦，此外还成立了多个旨在改善商业的工作组。

Colombia is one of the closest U.S. allies in the region. A middle-income nation and one of the oldest democracies in Latin America, it established ties with the United States in 1822.翻译:哥伦比亚是美国在该地区最亲密的盟友之一。作为一个中等收入国家，也是拉丁美洲最古老的民主国家之一，它于 1822 年与美国建立了联系。

Colombia has yet to join Xi's multi-region infrastructure Belt and Road Initiative (BRI), unlike many of its Latin American and Caribbean neighbours.翻译:与许多拉丁美洲和加勒比邻国不同，哥伦比亚尚未加入习近平的多区域基础设施“一带一路”倡议。

Former Colombia President Ivan Duque, who welcomed warmer ties with China and visited Beijing in 2019, had previously expressed a willingness to join the BRI.翻译:哥伦比亚前总统伊万·杜克欢迎与中国的关系升温，并于2019年访问北京，此前曾表示愿意加入“一带一路”。

'GREAT IMBALANCE'

On his arrival in Beijing on Tuesday, Petro hailed the potential to increase Colombian exports to China and re-launch the Andean country's national rail network.翻译:周二抵达北京时，佩特罗对增加哥伦比亚对中国出口和重新启动这个安第斯国家的国家铁路网络的潜力表示欢迎。

China Harbour Engineering Company (CHEC) is expected to complete by 2026 two subway lines of the Bogota Metro, a $4 billion project 30% funded by Chinese banks awarded to the CHEC, Xian Metro Company and Canada's Bombardier Inc consortium in 2019.翻译:中国港湾工程公司 (CHEC) 预计将在 2026 年之前完成波哥大地铁的两条地铁线路，该项目耗资 40 亿美元，其中 30% 由中资银行出资，并于 2019 年授予中国港湾工程公司、西安地铁公司和加拿大庞巴迪公司财团。

Colombia also awarded its RegioTram light rail system project to China Civil Engineering Construction Corporation (CCECC) in 2019.翻译:哥伦比亚还于2019年将其RegioTram轻轨系统项目授予中国土木工程建设集团公司（CCECC）。

Chinese state-run mining firm Zijin Mining acquired a gold mine in Colombia in 2019 but the project has faced repeated security issues and road blockades.翻译:中国国营矿业公司紫金矿业于2019年收购了哥伦比亚的一座金矿，但该项目多次面临安全问题和道路封锁。

Despite loans, investments and offers to build infrastructure, China was asked to import more from South America.翻译:尽管有贷款、投资和建设基础设施的提议，中国仍被要求从南美洲进口更多产品。

"When we look at the trade balance between Colombia and China, we find a great imbalance, a great inequality, a product of the economic history of the two countries," Petro told Xi on Wednesday. "There is a huge deficit."翻译:“当我们审视哥伦比亚和中国之间的贸易平衡时，我们发现严重的不平衡、严重的不平等，这是两国经济历史的产物，”佩特罗周三对习近平表示。 “存在巨大的赤字。”

Among the 11 South American countries that have diplomatic ties with Beijing, Colombia has the largest trade deficit with China despite increased Chinese imports. Colombia had a trade deficit of more than $8 billion last year.翻译:在与北京建交的11个南美国家中，尽管中国进口增加，但哥伦比亚对中国的贸易逆差最大。哥伦比亚去年的贸易逆差超过80亿美元。

Argentina, Venezuela, Bolivia and Suriname also posted trade deficits with China in 2022.翻译:阿根廷、委内瑞拉、玻利维亚和苏里南2022年也对中国出现贸易逆差。

Reporting by Liz Lee and Ryan Woo; Additional reporting by Ellen Zhang and Julia Symmes Cobb; Editing by Bernadette Baum, Robert Birsel, Nick Macfie and Mark Porter翻译:Liz Lee 和 Ryan Woo 的报道； Ellen 张和 Julia Symmes Cobb 的补充报道；编辑：Bernadette Baum、Robert Birsel、Nick Macfie 和 Mark Porter
item.author: Liz Lee, Ryan Woo

item.title: 加州州长纽瑟姆会见中国国家主席习近平
item.description:
California governor Gavin Newsom met Chinese president Xi Jinping on Wednesday to discuss climate change, raising hopes that China and the United States can find common ground ahead of an APEC summit and COP28 climate meeting next month.翻译:加州州长加文·纽瑟姆周三会见了中国国家主席习近平，讨论了气候变化问题，这让人们希望中美能够在下个月的亚太经合组织峰会和第二十八次缔约方会议气候会议之前找到共同点。

Xi and U.S President Joe Biden are expected to meet at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit in San Francisco in November, although the meeting has not been confirmed.翻译:习近平和美国总统乔·拜登预计将于 11 月在旧金山举行的亚太经合组织 (APEC) 峰会上会面，但会议尚未得到证实。

Newsom told reporters after the meeting that he had an opportunity to focus more deeply and substantively on the issue of climate with Xi, while they also discussed Israel and the deadly drug fentanyl.翻译:纽瑟姆在会后告诉记者，他有机会与习近平更深入、更实质性地关注气候问题，同时他们还讨论了以色列和致命药物芬太尼。

"We're not going to move the needle on climate change unless the United States and China collaborate together," he said.翻译:“除非美国和中国共同合作，否则我们不会在气候变化问题上取得进展，”他说。

There were "strategic red lines" in the relationship between the world's top two greenhouse gas emitters, but both sides were capable of managing them, he added.翻译:他补充说，世界最大的两个温室气体排放国之间的关系存在“战略红线”，但双方都有能力管理它们。

During their meeting, Xi told Newsom that there was "huge potential" for the two countries to cooperate on green development and addressing climate change, state broadcaster CCTV said.翻译:据中央电视台报道，习近平在会见期间告诉纽瑟姆，两国在绿色发展和应对气候变化方面的合作“潜力巨大”。

Xi said climate change could still become a "new bright spot" in the relationship between the two sides.翻译:习近平表示，气候变化仍可能成为双方关系的“新亮点”。

Climate cooperation between the two countries has been disrupted in recent years, with Chinese officials insisting that climate issues could not be treated in isolation from the broader diplomatic and trade disputes between the two sides.翻译:近年来，两国之间的气候合作受到干扰，中国官员坚称气候问题不能脱离两国之间更广泛的外交和贸易争端来处理。

U.S. climate envoy John Kerry visited Beijing in July to resume formal discussions with his Chinese counterpart Xie Zhenhua following a year-long hiatus caused by former House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan, a self-governing island that China claims.翻译:美国气候特使约翰·克里 (John Kerry) 于 7 月访问北京，恢复与中国同行解振华的正式讨论，此前众议院议长南希·佩洛西 (Nancy Pelosi) 访问台湾（中国声称拥有主权），导致这一讨论中断了一年。

Kerry's three-day visit also included talks with Foreign Minister Wang Yi and Vice-President Han Zheng, but he did not meet Xi.翻译:克里为期三天的访问还包括与外交部长王毅和国家副主席韩正举行会谈，但他没有会见习近平。

Newsom began his week-long trip to China on Monday, visiting Hong Kong and Shenzhen before meeting senior officials in Beijing on Wednesday, including Han and Wang.翻译:纽瑟姆周一开始了为期一周的中国之行，访问了香港和深圳，然后于周三在北京会见了包括韩和王在内的高级官员。

He also signed a memorandum of understanding with China's planning agency, the National Development and Reform Commission, on climate cooperation.翻译:他还与中国规划机构国家发展和改革委员会签署了气候合作谅解备忘录。

Reporting by Laurie Chen, Writing by David Stanway; Editing by Toby Chopra and Deborah Kyvrikosaios翻译:劳里·陈 (Laurie Chen) 报道，大卫·斯坦威 (David Stanway) 撰稿；托比·乔普拉 (Toby Chopra) 和黛博拉·基夫里科赛奥斯 (Deborah Kyvrikosaios) 编辑

item.title: 克里姆林宫表示，俄罗斯并不关心中国增加核武库能力
item.description:
The Kremlin said on Wednesday it was not concerned by China increasing the capabilities of its nuclear arsenal, stressing Moscow's "advanced strategic partnership" with Beijing and China's sovereign right to ensure its own security.翻译:克里姆林宫周三表示，并不担心中国增强核武库能力，并强调莫斯科与北京的“高级战略伙伴关系”以及中国确保自身安全的主权。

China has launched its first nuclear-powered guided missile submarines, according to the Pentagon's latest report on China's military, giving it land and sea attack options that were once the sole province of U.S. and Russian vessels.翻译:根据五角大楼关于中国军事的最新报告，中国已经下水了第一艘核动力导弹潜艇，使其拥有了陆地和海上攻击能力，而这曾经是美国和俄罗斯船只的唯一选择。

"This does not cause us concern, our relations are an advanced strategic partnership, we have the most advanced stage of political dialogue, economic interaction," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov told reporters.翻译:克里姆林宫发言人德米特里·佩斯科夫对记者表示：“这并没有引起我们的担忧，我们的关系是高级战略伙伴关系，我们拥有最先进的政治对话、经济互动阶段。”

"And in this case, China, which faces very serious challenges for its own security in the region, is taking steps that it considers appropriate.翻译:“在这种情况下，中国在该地区的自身安全面临非常严峻的挑战，正在采取它认为适当的措施。

"This is the absolute sovereign right of this country."翻译:“这是这个国家的绝对主权。”

Russia has forged even closer commercial, political and security ties with China, part of what they call a "no limits" partnership, since Moscow's decision to send tens of thousands of troops into Ukraine in February 2022, triggering sweeping Western sanctions.翻译:自2022年2月莫斯科决定向乌克兰派遣数万名军队并引发西方全面制裁以来，俄罗斯与中国建立了更加密切的商业、政治和安全关系，这是他们所谓的“无限制”伙伴关系的一部分。

The Pentagon report, published on Oct. 20, marks the first apparent confirmation that modified submarines seen in Chinese shipyards over the last 18 months are Type 093B guided missile submarines.翻译:五角大楼于 10 月 20 日发布的报告首次明显证实过去 18 个月在中国造船厂看到的改装潜艇是 093B 型导弹潜艇。

Russia has been tweaking its own legislation on nuclear matters this month, with parliament on Wednesday completing the passage of a law that withdraws Moscow's ratification of the global treaty banning nuclear weapons tests.翻译:俄罗斯本月一直在调整自己的核问题立法，议会周三完成了一项法律的通过，该法律撤回了莫斯科对禁止核武器试验全球条约的批准。

Russia says it will not resume nuclear testing unless Washington does, but arms control experts are concerned it may be inching towards a test that the West would perceive as a threatening escalation in the context of the Ukraine war.翻译:俄罗斯表示，除非华盛顿恢复核试验，否则它不会恢复核试验，但军控专家担心，俄罗斯可能正在缓慢进行核试验，而西方会认为这是乌克兰战争背景下的威胁性升级。

Reporting by Reuters; Writing by Alexander Marrow Editing by Gareth Jones翻译:路透社报道；亚历山大·马罗 (Alexander Marrow) 撰稿 加雷斯·琼斯 (Gareth Jones) 编辑
item.author: Reuters

item.title: 官员表示，随着预算赤字上升，中国发行新债券将有助于经济复苏
item.description:
China's new sovereign bonds will help bolster the economic recovery, China's vice finance minister Zhu Zhongming said on Wednesday, as the government's stepped-up fiscal stimulus sharply raises its budget deficit.翻译:中国财政部副部长朱忠明周三表示，中国新发行的主权债券将有助于促进经济复苏，因为政府加大财政刺激力度，导致预算赤字大幅上升。

China's top parliament body has approved a 1 trillion yuan ($137 billion) in sovereign bond issuance to help rebuild areas hit by this year's floods and improve urban infrastructure to cope with future disasters, state media said on Tuesday.翻译:官方媒体周二称，中国最高人大机构已批准发行1万亿元人民币（1370亿美元）的主权债券，以帮助重建今年遭受洪水袭击的地区，并改善城市基础设施以应对未来的灾害。

"After the treasury bond funds are put into use, it will help drive domestic demand and further consolidate the recovery of the economy," Zhu said at a news conference.翻译:朱镕基在新闻发布会上表示：“国债资金投入使用后，将有利于拉动内需，进一步巩固经济复苏。”

The world's second-largest economy grew faster than expected in the third quarter, improving the chances that Beijing can meet its growth target of around 5% for 2023. But economists say the crisis-hit property sector remains a drag on the economy and continues to cloud the growth outlook.翻译:全球第二大经济体第三季度增长快于预期，提高了北京实现 2023 年 5% 左右增长目标的机会。但经济学家表示，遭受危机打击的房地产行业仍然拖累经济，并将继续拖累经济。增长前景蒙上阴影。

In a rare move, China sharply lifted its 2023 budget deficit to around 3.8% of gross domestic product from an originally set 3% due to the rise in central government debt, according to state media.翻译:据官方媒体报道，由于中央政府债务增加，中国罕见地将2023年预算赤字占国内生产总值的比例从最初设定的3%大幅提高至3.8%左右。

The proposed increase in bond issuance comes as Beijing prepares to inject a fresh dose of fiscal stimulus to shore up the economic recovery, policy insiders say, but there are worries reverting to debt-funded stimulus would undermine the move to a consumer-led economic growth model.翻译:政策人士表示，拟议增加债券发行之际，北京正准备注入新一剂财政刺激措施以支撑经济复苏，但有人担心，恢复债务融资刺激措施将破坏向消费者主导型经济增长的转变模型。

Some analysts played down the near-term positive economic impact of the new debt issuance.翻译:一些分析师淡化了新债发行对近期经济的积极影响。

"We believe the economic impact of this 1 trillion yuan in additional CGBs (Chinese government bonds) should not be overstated, especially in the near term," Ting Lu, chief China economist at Nomura, said in a note.翻译:野村证券首席中国经济学家陆挺在一份报告中表示：“我们认为，不应过分夸大新增1万亿元人民币国债的经济影响，尤其是在短期内。”

"Fiscal multiplier effects from spending on water conservancy projects is likely to be rather limited."翻译:“水利工程支出的财政乘数效应可能相当有限。”

China will reasonably set the pace of bond insurance and match the issuance with spending, Zhu said, adding that authorities will take steps to prevent bond fund misuses.翻译:朱表示，中国将合理安排债券保险节奏，实现发行与支出相匹配，并采取措施防止债券基金滥用。

The government's debt level is still within a reasonable range, the minister said, without giving details.翻译:这位部长表示，政府债务水平仍处于合理范围内，但没有透露细节。

Some policy advisers say the central government has room to spend more as its debt as a share of GDP is just 21%, far lower than 76% for local governments.翻译:一些政策顾问表示，中央政府有增加支出的空间，因为其债务占GDP的比重仅为21%，远低于地方政府的76%。

Half of the funds raised via the bond issuance will be spent this year and the other half will be used next year, according to state media said.翻译:据官方媒体报道，通过债券发行筹集的资金一半将在今年使用，另一半将在明年使用。

Analysts at UBS expect the government to raise its budget deficit and special local bond quotas for 2024, alongside further cuts in interest rates and bank reserve requirement ratios.翻译:瑞银分析师预计，政府将提高2024年的预算赤字和特别地方债券配额，同时进一步降低利率和银行存款准备金率。

China's parliament has also approved a bill to allow local governments to front load part of 2024 local bond quotas.翻译:中国人大还批准了一项法案，允许地方政府提前加载部分2024年地方债券额度。

Local governments had been told to complete the issuance of the 2023 quota of 3.8 trillion yuan in special local bonds by September to fund infrastructure projects.翻译:地方政府被告知要在9月份之前完成2023年3.8万亿元地方专项债券额度的发行，为基础设施项目提供资金。
